chapter.title: ⪪ Installation
chapter.para: ⪪ is an add-on product for &sls; 11 systems. Install the &sls; 11 base system and add ⪪. You can either install the ⪪ add-on together with your base system during the initial installation process, or on top of an already-installed base system at any later time.

sect1.title: Installation During the Initial Installation Process
sect1.para: To install the ⪪ add-on together with your base system during the initial installation process, follow these steps:

step.para: Start the &sls; 11 installation as usual. For more information, see the &sls; documentation coming with the base product.
To include the ⪪ add-on product, check the Include Add-On Products from Separate Media option in the Installation Mode dialog in the System Analysis step, and click Next.

In the next dialog, click Add and, if you are installing ⪪ from a local ISO image, select Local ISO Image as the media type (repository). If you are installing from a different source, such as CD, NFS, or HTTP, choose the appropriate type. Then click Next.
If you are installing from a CD, insert the ⪪ add-on product CD. If you are installing from a different source, provide the necessary repository information.
Confirm the ⪪ license agreement and click Next.

The ⪪ add-on product is displayed in the overview. Continue with the installation as usual. Make sure that the ⪪: Subscription Management Tool for SLE installation pattern is selected automatically and do not remove it.
A two-step ⪪ Configuration Wizard is shown during the final steps of the installation workflow. Configure ⪪ as described in and continue with the &sls; installation as usual.

sect1.title: Installation on Top of an Already Installed System
sect1.para: To install ⪪ on top of an already-installed base system, follow these steps:

step.para: Start &yast; and select Software Add-On Product . Then click Add.

If you are installing ⪪ from a local ISO image, select Local ISO Image as the media type (repository). If you are installing from a different source, such as CD, NFS, or HTTP, choose the appropriate type. Then click Next.
If you are installing from a CD, insert the ⪪ add-on product CD. If you are installing from a different source, provide the necessary repository information.
Confirm the ⪪ license agreement and click Next.
Click Accept to install the ⪪: Subscription Management Tool for SLE pattern.
Depending on the scope of already installed packages, the software manager will add more packages to resolve all dependencies. Confirm these Automatic Changes to perform the installation.
The ⪪ Configuration Wizard is launched. See .

sect1.title: ⪪ Configuration Wizard
sect1.para: During the installation of ⪪ the two-step ⪪ Configuration Wizard is launched, regardless of the used installation method. Configure ⪪ using this wizard. You are able to change the configuration later using the &yast; ⪪ Server Configuration module— see .

step.para: The Enable Subscription Management Tool service (⪪) option is checked by default. Uncheck it only if you want to disable the installed ⪪.
If the firewall is enabled, check Open Port in Firewall to allow access to the ⪪ service from remote computers.

Enter your &ncc; mirroring credentials in User and Password. If you do not know your &ncc; credentials, refer to . Test the entered credentials by pressing the Test button. ⪪ will connect to the Customer Center server using the provided credentials and download some testing data.
Enter the e-mail address you have used for the &ncc; registration into NCC E-mail Used for Registration.
Your ⪪ Server URL should contain the URL of the ⪪ server being configured. It is populated automatically.
Press Next to continue to the second configuration step.
For security reasons, ⪪ requires a separate user to connect to the database. With Database Password for smt User set the database password for that user. Confirm it in the following field.
Enter all e-mail addresses that ⪪ should send reports to using the Add button. You are also able to Edit or Delete any incorrect or obsolete addresses.
Then click Next.
If the current MySQL root password is empty—as in any freshly installed system—you will be asked to enter a New MySQL Root Password.
